Articles.Content:
Hello gaming Astronauts! Today I'll explain safe ways to play Kerbal space program. Here we go!

1: Always you shouldn't play with too much mods. KSP will run very slow and you will not enjoy so much it.

2: Don't put the details texture so much detailed it will also get running slower.

3: Don't edit folders of KSP because, if you don't know to edit you will cannot play KSP.

4: Always get the charger of you computer when you play KSP. Because it consumes a lot of electric charge (I learn it with the Z-100 battery)

and finally... 5: Son't make big spaceships like ShadowZone because then the game runs very very slow. One day I played KSP with a spaceship of 1000 parts and the game crashed . Thanks for reading the safe tips for play Kerbal space program. Bye!
Can we end this whole "1000-part rocket crashed my game" meme?
How is this development discussion exactly?  What is the point of this thread, besides being inaccurate?

Yes this thread needs to be moved. 1 and 2 and 5 are all possible with a good PC. 3 It isn't too hard to edit the game without making it unplayable and 4 I am always charging my PC. Only someone with a small laptop would want to unplug the charger to take it for instance on a trip.

Fire

Yes it does need to be moved. I didn't know that until someone stopped complaining and hit the report button though.

KSP Sanity Tip: Always keep a backup before upgrading and moving saves over to new versions. In fact make backups before adding mods, removing mods. Make backups before making backups! Backups are good.

1 hour ago, SpaceastronautX said:

1: Always you shouldn't play with too much mods. KSP will run very slow and you will not enjoy so much it.

1. Know the limits of your system.  Too many mods is a matter of personal taste that you will have to decide for yourself.

 

1 hour ago, SpaceastronautX said:

2: Don't put the details texture so much detailed it will also get running slower.

2. Know the limits of your system, and what you are willing to live with.

 

1 hour ago, SpaceastronautX said:

3: Don't edit folders of KSP because, if you don't know to edit you will cannot play KSP.

3. Know the limits of your skills.  Never do anything on a computer you are not absolutely sure of unless you are willing to deal with the consequences.  Backups are good.

 

1 hour ago, SpaceastronautX said:

4: Always get the charger of you computer when you play KSP.

4. Know the limits of your system.  Most modern systems require electricity.  If you try to play without electricity, your graphics quality may suffer.

 

1 hour ago, SpaceastronautX said:

5: Son't make big spaceships like ShadowZone because then the game runs very very slow.

5. Know the limits of your system.  You will find a trade off between parts and performance.  Learn where your personal tastes lie.

 

Most of all, make sure you always follow arbitrary guidelines and double check with other users to make sure you are actually enjoying the game.  Some players have been known to claim they are having fun, but are simply too dense to know when they are enjoying KSP.  (It's always a good idea to ask whether or not certain mods are considered "cheating".)

On 10/11/2016 at 8:43 PM, razark said:

1. Know the limits of your system.  Too many mods is a matter of personal taste that you will have to decide for yourself.

 

2. Know the limits of your system, and what you are willing to live with.

 

3. Know the limits of your skills.  Never do anything on a computer you are not absolutely sure of unless you are willing to deal with the consequences.  Backups are good.

 

4. Know the limits of your system.  Most modern systems require electricity.  If you try to play without electricity, your graphics quality may suffer.

 

5. Know the limits of your system.  You will find a trade off between parts and performance.  Learn where your personal tastes lie.

 

Most of all, make sure you always follow arbitrary guidelines and double check with other users to make sure you are actually enjoying the game.  Some players have been known to claim they are having fun, but are simply too dense to know when they are enjoying KSP.  (It's always a good idea to ask whether or not certain mods are considered "cheating".)

What a large comment! Well I know that if you had the most fast computer it will run okey but, I say like a tipical KSP gamer
